# Calculate eigenvalues for different truncations of the matrix
eigenvalues = []
for i in range(2, E_matrix.shape[0], 2):
    E_matrix_trunc = E_matrix[:i, :i]
    eigvals = np.linalg.eigvalsh(E_matrix_trunc)
    eigenvalues.append(eigvals)
print(eigenvalues)
# Convert list of eigenvalues to numpy array for easier plotting
eigenvalues = np.array(eigenvalues)

# Plot eigenvalues
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
for i in range(eigenvalues.shape[1]):
    plt.plot(range(2, E_matrix.shape[0], 2), eigenvalues[:, i], label=f'Eigenvalue {i+1}')
plt.xlabel('Number of basis states')
plt.ylabel('Eigenvalue')
plt.title('Convergence of Eigenvalues with Increasing Basis States')
plt.legend()
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()
